text: is there any way to get the FTP to deliver useful errors when a file fails to get updated on the server?
I’d be okay with having them show up in the notification bell thing or having to go into a special page to view the  errors.
I am trying to update a fields.json file and I keep getting my updates rejected and I can’t figure out why.
having a heck of a time figuring out how to get my fields file updated. I have to add like several fields with kind of a complex structure so I don’t want to have to do this manually.
We’ve been in the process of adding some more descriptive errors. What error are you currently getting back?
<https://spin.d.pr/8vjiRs+>
all i get is could not start transfer
in the past i have gotten this when the json isnt formatted properly, but i cant find anything wrong with what i currently am trying to upload
Would you mind DMing me the JSON you are trying to upload?

Unrelated to my other feedback.

This may not be possible due to some structural stuff but it’d be nice if in the listing of portals in FTP if the portal name came before the ID.

when you have over a hundred portals it gets hard to find them because they will always be ordered based on their ID not their name

another FTP issue - CodeAnywhere FTP seems to have issues when transferring files. the only error I see is “socket hang up”

I realize CodeAnywhere probably isn’t the most popular FTP client out there but it’s growing in usage and if it’s having issues, it’s likely other FTP clients have the same issue
I assume you’re using CodeAnywhere in lieu of the design manager? I’m curious as to why?

I’m not using it in lieu of the design manager. I guess you could say I was using FTP in lieu of the design manager in general. The reason being there’s no easy way to copy fields and field groups from one module to another
Ohh ok, so you’re not developing full time in there

I’m not but if I felt it developing locally worked more smoothly I would actually be using that a lot of the time. CodeAnywhere is my preferred FTP client - requires no software on your computer, completely browser based and has an app, which allows you to do all of the same stuff you’d do on desktop but with an interface optimized for mobile.

Works more smoothly than filezilla and transmit. albeit not with HubSpot for some reason.
One of the big perks if I could use codeanywhere instead is that it already has support for Emmet, and a lot of advanced code editor features that the design manager does not currently support
Good to know. Filezilla is my go to but it is so brutal. I agree the code editor features would be nice to have as well.
I’d like to see the DM adopt features like emmet, but ultimately I think better support for working locally will open way more doors for devs

I agree.

On the emmet side. I actually may be able to add it through the chrome extension, but unfortunately I’d need to know a variable name that you guys are using for codemirror but the react code is obfuscating it
Still something the team is thinking about believe

I can tell you every time I’ve brought it up in the feedback area it gets atleast 10 people supporting it every time.

And if HS decides internally not to do it, I’m going to see what I can do to make it happen through the extension
I can cope without SCSS(because you gave us HubL) but coding without emmet feels like I’m coding in notepad in 1995. lol
